messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "sam.gribbles" <sam.gribbles@...> wrote:
>
> Hi All,
>
> I'm new to Junit testing and have been able to do some basic
testing
> etc.
> What I want to do now is test for objects that are returned in
random
> order. E.G. I have a few Fortune Cookies that are stored in an
array
of
> Strings. I've written some code that returns them randomly.
> What is the best method for testing? i.e. should I be using Mocks?
> If anybody has any good examples or relevant web sites please let
me
> know.
>
> Your help is greatly appreciated.
>
> Sam.
>


Hi all,
Thanks for your efforts in attempting to answer my question.

I'll try and be more clear:

The task I've been given is meant to introduce me to Junit testing.
So
I started simply by writing a few methods that produce a single hard
coded Fortune Cookie. That was easy to test.

The next step was to produce a random cookie. This is where it gets
tricky. I've written a basic method that returns a random fortune
cookie quote (see below).

String[] fortuneCookieQuote = new String[]
{"fortune cookie quote 1",
"fortune cookie quote 2",
"fortune cookie quote 3",
"fortune cookie quote 4"};

public String getFortuneCookieQuote(){
Random r = new Random();
return fortuneCookieQuote[r.nextInt(4)];

}

As you can all see it is a simple program to create. The question is
what would be the best way to test this? If anybody knows of any good
web sites that explain testing (e.g. mocks, junit etc) please let me
know.

Once again your assistance is appreciated.

Sam.
